title: King Charles' Warm Hug With New Zealand Women's Rugby Team
content: King Charles shared a joyful moment with the New Zealand women's rugby union team at Buckingham Palace, where he exchanged hugs with the Black Ferns.
summary: King Charles shared a joyful moment with the New Zealand women's rugby union team at Buckingham Palace, where he exchanged hugs with the Black Ferns.

title: PricewaterhouseCoopers Fires 1,800 Employees In 1st Major Layoff Since 2009
content: PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) is set to lay off approximately 1,800 employees in the United States, marking its first major round of layoffs since 2009.
summary: PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) is set to lay off approximately 1,800 employees in the United States, marking its first major round of layoffs since 2009.

title: Australian To Have New Privacy Laws To Prohibit Doxxing
content: The act of doxxing by releasing someone's personal information without consent will be made a criminal offence in Australia under new government privacy laws.
summary: The act of doxxing by releasing someone's personal information without consent will be made a criminal offence in Australia under new government privacy laws.

title: Surfer To 'Trump Whisperer': Who Can Become Japan's Next Prime Minister?
content: A photogenic political scion, a military model-maker and a hardliner hoping to become Japan's first woman prime minister are among nine candidates vying to lead the world's fourth-largest economy.
summary: A photogenic political scion, a military model-maker and a hardliner hoping to become Japan's first woman prime minister are among nine candidates vying to lead the world's fourth-largest economy.

title: Opinion: 'Net ID' To New Books, Xi's Ideological Grip On China Is Tightening
content: Through greater social control, the Party seeks to protect itself from the fate of the erstwhile Soviet Union, whose political model forms the foundation for China.
summary: Through greater social control, the Party seeks to protect itself from the fate of the erstwhile Soviet Union, whose political model forms the foundation for China.

title: Peru's Ex-President Alberto Fujimori Dies At 86
content: Peru's former president Alberto Fujimori, who ruled his country with an iron fist and then spent 16 years in prison for crimes against humanity, died on Wednesday at age 86 in the capital Lima.
summary: Peru's former president Alberto Fujimori, who ruled his country with an iron fist and then spent 16 years in prison for crimes against humanity, died on Wednesday at age 86 in the capital Lima.

title: Death Count Rises To 197 In Vietnam After Typhoon Yagi
content: The number of people killed after Typhoon Yagi swept through northern Vietnam bringing flash floods and landslides has risen to 197, the government said Thursday.
summary: The number of people killed after Typhoon Yagi swept through northern Vietnam bringing flash floods and landslides has risen to 197, the government said Thursday.

title: Harris, Trump Battle For Swing States After Fierce 1st Presidential Debate
content: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump return to the campaign trail Thursday, with the Democrat hoping her dominant display in their first presidential debate will boost her chances in the knife-edge US election.
summary: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump return to the campaign trail Thursday, with the Democrat hoping her dominant display in their first presidential debate will boost her chances in the knife-edge US election.

title: "Disconnected Billionaire": JD Vance As Taylor Swift Backs Kamala Harris
content: Taylor Swift endorsed Kamala Harris over Donald Trump in an Instagram post on Tuesday, calling her a "steady-handed, gifted leader."
summary: Taylor Swift endorsed Kamala Harris over Donald Trump in an Instagram post on Tuesday, calling her a "steady-handed, gifted leader."

title: Bill Gates Shares His No. 1 Concern That Keeps Him Up At Night
content: For Mr Gates, the key question during a future pandemic would be whether nations are better prepared than they were for the outbreak of Covid-19.
summary: For Mr Gates, the key question during a future pandemic would be whether nations are better prepared than they were for the outbreak of Covid-19.

title: What 9/11 Attacks Looked Like From Space: NASA Shares Haunting Image
content: On the 23rd anniversary of the September 11 attacks, NASA has released a letter from the only American astronaut in space at the time, Frank Culbertson, who was reflecting on witnessing the tragedy from the International Space Station (ISS).
summary: On the 23rd anniversary of the September 11 attacks, NASA has released a letter from the only American astronaut in space at the time, Frank Culbertson, who was reflecting on witnessing the tragedy from the International Space Station (ISS).

title: Starbucks' New CEO Shares His Go-To Career Advice: "I Know It's a Cliche"

title: "It's Over," Said Killer On Tape As He Stabbed US Woman 46 Times
content: A homeless man has been convicted of stabbing a college student 46 times and recording the brutal attack in US' Los Angeles, reports said. In the audio recording, the man can be heard promising not to hurt her.
summary: A homeless man has been convicted of stabbing a college student 46 times and recording the brutal attack in US' Los Angeles, reports said. In the audio recording, the man can be heard promising not to hurt her.

title: Taylor Swift's Instagram Post Endorsing Kamala Harris Gets 9 Million 'Likes'
content: Soon after Kamala Harris finished debating her rival Donald Trump on Tuesday, Taylor Swift told her 283 million followers that the Democrat would get her vote in the US election.
summary: Soon after Kamala Harris finished debating her rival Donald Trump on Tuesday, Taylor Swift told her 283 million followers that the Democrat would get her vote in the US election.

title: Biden Sports Trump Hat At 9/11 Event, White House Calls It A Show Of "Unity"
content: US President Joe Biden was dared to put on adversary Donald Trump's signature red hat as he attended commemorative events with Vice President Kamala Harris.
summary: US President Joe Biden was dared to put on adversary Donald Trump's signature red hat as he attended commemorative events with Vice President Kamala Harris.

title: Hours After Fiery Debate, Trump And Kamala Harris Attend 9/11 Memorial
content: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump shook hands Wednesday at New York's 9/11 memorial to mark the anniversary of the attacks, briefly putting politics aside hours after they clashed in a fiery presidential debate.
summary: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump shook hands Wednesday at New York's 9/11 memorial to mark the anniversary of the attacks, briefly putting politics aside hours after they clashed in a fiery presidential debate.

title: SpaceX Astronauts Set For First Private Spacewalk
content: A group of private astronauts is set to carry out the first private spacewalk in orbit on Thursday from a SpaceX capsule, testing a new line of spacesuits.
summary: A group of private astronauts is set to carry out the first private spacewalk in orbit on Thursday from a SpaceX capsule, testing a new line of spacesuits.

title: North Korea Fires Multiple Short-Range Ballistic Missiles: South Korea
content: North Korea fired multiple short range ballistic missiles into waters east of the Korean peninsula Thursday, Seoul's military reported, days after the nuclear-armed North marked a state anniversary.
summary: North Korea fired multiple short range ballistic missiles into waters east of the Korean peninsula Thursday, Seoul's military reported, days after the nuclear-armed North marked a state anniversary.

title: Ex-CIA Officer Gets 10 Years In Prison For Spying For China
content: A former CIA officer was sentenced on Wednesday to 10 years in prison after pleaded guilty to spying for China, the U.S. Justice Department said.
summary: A former CIA officer was sentenced on Wednesday to 10 years in prison after pleaded guilty to spying for China, the U.S. Justice Department said.

title: Hamas Says Ready To Implement Ceasefire Without New Conditions
content: The Palestinian Hamas group said on Wednesday that its negotiators reiterated its readiness to implement an "immediate" ceasefire with Israel in Gaza based on a previous U.S. proposal without new conditions from any party.
summary: The Palestinian Hamas group said on Wednesday that its negotiators reiterated its readiness to implement an "immediate" ceasefire with Israel in Gaza based on a previous U.S. proposal without new conditions from any party.
